Bag O' Links - 6/5/2009 Elad Meidar

07 May 2009

  • Test your fonts – A nice tool to test your website font-face schemes, you can also get recommendations for safe font-families.
  • Using Javascript in HAML – Mix it right and serve.
  • RecordFilter – Another DSL based SQL query builder, nice.
  • JSONP, quickly – what is JSONP and how to use it.
  • Sound Manager 2 – wrapping and extending Flash 8’s sound API, SoundManager 2 brings solid audio functionality to Javascript.
  • Rack Use case – API throttling – Finally a better reason to use Rack, although i’m not convinced yet.
  • A collection of useful rake tasks – yaii… i love nukes.
  • Ruby on Rails and Google Maps – Just talked about it today with the guys over at RailsBridge… that would come handy pretty soon.
  • Fix a bug in Ruby, get more performance – They don’t point to which Ruby version they are referring too, would be nice to know.
  • Clean Markup – do it rite.
